header.name: Yorick Van de Venne.
header.punchline: I build things for the web.
header.shortDescription: I'm a web developer specializing in creating scalable and responsive websites. Currently, I'm employed as Back-end Developer at Level Level. But feel free to contact me if you have any questions or if you're interested in working together.

about.title: About Me
about.description:
My name is Yorick and I am a young and ambitious web developer. I'm a true all-rounder, I like to learn new stuff and keep improving myself. It's also the reason why I love coding so much as there is always something new to learn.

My ambition is to become a lead full-stack developer. Though my interests for front-end development exceed my back-end interests (by far), I want to have enough knowlegde of both to independently be able to develop websites.

When I'm not working you can find me in the gym, on the tennis court or playing the guitar! Also I enjoy cooking, but mostly the eating part!

Here are a few technologies I've been working with recently:

jobDescription.description: Custom integrations: In various projects, I assisted clients in integrating their existing CRM systems with WordPress. For the Fietsersbond (Cyclists' Union), I developed a custom integration with Microsoft Dynamics, ensuring that new members who signed up via the website were automatically added to Dynamics' membership administration.

Automated unit tests: For various projects, I developed a series of unit tests. For The A11y Collective, I wrote tests for critical functions, such as the checkout process in WooCommerce and the course completion workflow.

Web accessibility: Through courses and hands-on experience, I gained extensive knowledge about web accessibility. This enhanced my awareness of common pitfalls, enabling me to develop front-end solutions with a focus on improving accessibility for everyone.
API development: For MS Amlin, I developed a RESTful API that allowed users to find nearby brokers based on their postal code.

Pixel-perfect implementation of designs: For the client portal of High Profile Locations (HPL), I was responsible for translating the design into a pixel-perfect implementation. I critically reviewed the designs, discussed improvements with the designers, and implemented the necessary enhancements.

Fully responsive development: For various projects, I ensured that the front-end performed optimally across all devices and screen sizes. For Aviko, for example, I developed a product accordion in Next.js that works seamlessly on desktop, tablet, and mobile.

Handling data from APIs: For various projects, I retrieved necessary data from APIs. I used GraphQL for efficient data fetching and ensured type safety with TypeScript. With Next.js, I effectively loaded data and connected it to the appropriate components.

Scalability of components: Scalability was a central focus in every project. For HPL, I was responsible for developing various React components that could be easily reused and adapted for different use cases.
Support tickets: Resolving minor issues and communicating with clients.
Graduation internship: About providing insights into productivity.

Note: In the two/three years I worked at Burst, I started as a trainee with a zero hour contract and did two internships. So during my studies I always kept working at Burst. In my last year at Burst, the company fused with other companies and became iO.

featuredProjects.title: HPL Portal
featuredProjects.summary: The client High Profile Locaties (HPL) wanted to build a website where venue holders could offer there venue to be used for various occasions. I was later envolved in the development proces to work on the portal, where venue holders can create and manage their venues. I've worked on this project as front-end developer a few months and delivered all kinds of features, read more to find out.
featuredProjects.description: Designed and developed a mobile-responsive website...

featuredProjects.title: MS Amlin - Find your broker
featuredProjects.summary: The client MS Amlin wanted to build a website where users could find a broker near them. I was responsible for the development of the front-end and the back-end. I used Next.js for the front-end and WordPress for the back-end. I also created a custom API to handle the data from the WordPress back-end.

mainImage.alt: MS Amlin - Find your broker map

featuredProjects.description: Designed and developed a mobile-responsive website...

featuredProjects.title: De Fietersbond
featuredProjects.summary: The client De Fietsersbond wanted to build a website where users could find a bike route near them. I was responsible for the development of the front-end and the back-end. I used Next.js for the front-end and WordPress for the back-end. I also created a custom API to handle the data from the WordPress back-end.
featuredProjects.description: Designed and developed a mobile-responsive website...

projects.title: Portfolio Website
projects.summary: This very website is a great example of my skill. Using my favorite tech stack I built this portfolio to showcase my work experiences, projects and documentation to possible future employers.

projects.title: Aviko QR Code
projects.summary: The client Aviko wanted to add QR codes to their packages to attract more visitors. But their packages can be found all over the world and depending on where you scan the package the QR code should redirect you to the correct landingpage. This was the challange I had to deal with while creating a custom Drupal module to manage the redirects and setting up a Node.js server to handle all the redirecting and getting the users location.
projects.description: This is the long version of the description.

projects.title: Aviko Sprint 8
projects.summary: During my employement at iO I participated in a sprint for the client Aviko, I was assigned multiple front-end tickets which I worked on during the 2 week sprint.

projects.title: Verno Customized frames
projects.summary: The Client Verno (framer) wanted users to be able to see what there art would look like with the frames Verno offered. That's why Burst created a subdomain where users could customize there frame. This was a very complex application which had predefined steps, but Verno wanted the users to be able to share their work with others during any part of this customize proces. So my task during my internship at Burst was to have the steps with it's content tracked within the URL as a Base64 string.
projects.description: Designed and developed a mobile-responsive website...

projects.title: Tinyhouse: Fullstack React Masterclass
projects.summary: During my time working at Burst I was offered to follow the Tinyhouse: Fullstack React Masterclass. Where I learned how to create an entire website (the tinyhouse application) from skretch.

projects.title: Graduation project: Productivity
projects.summary: During my graduation project at iO, I researched how productivity could become insightful. I experimented with some ideas and created this static application based on my findings, note this was created for testing purposes.

projects.title: Internship: Next.js blog
projects.summary: During to internship at Burst I created a blog website using Drupal and Next.js to expirement with the different rendering methods of Next.js.

contact.title: Get In Touch
contact.description: Feel free to reach out to me if you have any questions or if you're interested in working together or just really feel like saying hello.
